cookieMain: Diese Cookies sind für das ordnungsgemäße Funktionieren unserer Website erforderlich und können in unseren Systemen nicht abgeschaltet werden. unseren Systemen nicht ausgeschaltet werden. Sie werden in der Regel nur als Reaktion auf von Ihnen durchgeführte Aktionen gesetzt, die auf eine wie das Einstellen Ihrer Datenschutzeinstellungen, das Einloggen oder das Ausfüllen von Formularen oder wenn sie unerlässlich sind, um eine von Ihnen angeforderte Dienstleistung zu erbringen. Sie können sich nicht gegen diesen Cookies nicht widersprechen. Sie können Ihren Browser so einstellen, dass er diese Cookies blockiert oder Sie darauf hinweist, aber dann Wenn Sie dies tun, werden einige Teile der Website nicht funktionieren. Diese Cookies speichern keine persönlich identifizierbaren Informationen.

projectDescription: The project "Intercommunal Funding Scouting Platform North Frisia" is a model project within the framework of the funding initiative "Heimat 2.0" of the Federal Ministry for Housing, Urban Development and Building (BMWSB) in cooperation with the Federal Institute for Research on Building, Urban Affairs and Spatial Development (BBSR).
contactForRegistration: To register as a user (administration), please contact foerderscouting-plattform@amt-vioel.de
projectIdeasDescription: Users have the possibility to create their own project ideas and share them in the network.
fundingShortInfosDescription: Brief and clear description of current funding opportunities.
implementationChecklistsDescription: View and reuse funding projects from project idea to grant decision.
platformGoalDescription: The goal of the platform is to strengthen the long-term capacity for action of municipalities in the context of the general development process "from idea to project". Against the background of developing liveable municipalities and securing services of general interest, it is becoming increasingly essential for structurally weak regions to bundle and share existing development resources (project knowledge, personnel and funding) in a knowledge network.
platformAssistanceSystemDescription: The platform forms a digital assistance system for the development, promotion and implementation of municipal projects. The result is a knowledge platform that
platformBenefit1: simplifies the respective project idea management of municipalities
platformBenefit2: connects different project ideas and suitable funding opportunities more directly and
platformBenefit3: provides experiences for project implementation in the form of checklists as "Short Service Path 2.0".
sustainabilityDescription: For further sustainability, the North Frisian municipalities will define terms of use that enable access for other municipalities after the test phase.
limitedAccessDescription: Access to the platform is therefore currently limited. To apply for a user account, please click on the corresponding field in the login window at a later time.
mustBeAtLeast8Characters: Must be at least 8 characters long.
mustContainUppercase: Must contain at least one uppercase letter.
mustContainNumber: Must contain at least one number.
mustContainSpecialCharacter: Must contain at least one special character: !@#$%^&*()-_+=
projectDescriptionDetailed: The project "Intercommunal Funding Scouting Platform North Frisia" is a model project within the framework of the funding initiative "Heimat 2.0" of the Federal Ministry for Housing, Urban Development and Building (BMWSB) in cooperation with the Federal Institute for Research on Building, Urban Affairs and Spatial Development (BBSR).
platformGoal: The goal of the platform is the long-term strengthening of the ability of municipalities to act within the framework of the general development process "from idea to project". Against the background of developing livable communities and securing public infrastructure, it is becoming increasingly essential for structurally weak regions to bundle and share existing development resources (project knowledge, personnel and funding) in a knowledge network.
platformDescription: The platform forms a digital assistance system for the development, promotion and implementation of municipal projects. The result is a knowledge platform that
simplifyProjectManagement: simplifies the respective project idea management of municipalities
connectProjectsAndFunding: connects different project ideas and suitable funding opportunities more directly and
provideImplementationChecklists: provides experiences for project implementation in the form of checklists as "Short Service Path 2.0".
sustainabilityNote: For further sustainability, the North Frisian municipalities will define terms of use that enable access for other municipalities after the test phase.

impressum.onlineContentText: The operator of the website named in the imprint assumes no liability for the timeliness, correctness, completeness or quality of the information provided. Liability claims, which refer to damages of a material or immaterial nature, caused by the use or non-use of the information provided or through the use of incorrect and incomplete information, are fundamentally excluded, unless the operator named in the imprint is proven to have acted intentionally or with gross negligence.
impressum.offersText: All offers are non-binding and subject to change. The operator expressly reserves the right to change, supplement, delete parts of the pages or the entire offer without separate announcement or to discontinue publication temporarily or permanently.
impressum.linksText: For direct or indirect references to external websites ("links") that are outside the operator's area of responsibility, a liability obligation would only come into effect if the operator has knowledge of the content and it would be technically possible and reasonable for him to prevent use in the case of illegal content.
impressum.linksDisclaimerText: The operator hereby expressly declares that at the time of linking, no illegal content was recognizable on the pages to be linked. The operator has no influence on the current and future design, content or authorship of the linked pages. Therefore, he hereby expressly distances himself from all content of all linked pages that were changed after the link was set. This statement applies to all links and references set within his own website as well as to third-party entries in guest books, discussion forums and mailing lists set up by the author. For illegal, incorrect or incomplete content and in particular for damages arising from the use or non-use of such information, only the provider of the page to which reference was made is liable, not the one who merely refers to the respective publication via links.
impressum.copyrightText1: The operator strives to observe the copyrights of the graphics, audio documents, video sequences and texts used in all publications, to use graphics, audio documents, video sequences and texts created by himself or to use license-free graphics, audio documents, video sequences and texts.
impressum.copyrightText2: All trademarks and trademarks mentioned within the website and possibly protected by third parties are subject without restriction to the provisions of the respectively valid trademark law and the ownership rights of the respective registered owners. The mere mention does not lead to the conclusion that trademarks are not protected by third party rights!
impressum.copyrightText3: The copyright for published objects created by the operator himself remains solely with the operator of the pages. Reproduction or use of such graphics, audio documents, video sequences and texts in other electronic or printed publications is not permitted without the express consent of the operator.
impressum.dataProtectionText: The protection of your personal data during collection, processing and use on the occasion of your visit to our homepage is an important concern for us. Your data is protected within the framework of legal regulations. In our privacy policy you will find information about which data is collected during your visit to the homepage and how it is used.
impressum.legalValidityText: This disclaimer is to be regarded as part of the internet offer from which this page was referenced. If parts or individual formulations of this text do not, no longer or not completely correspond to the current legal situation, the remaining parts of the document remain unaffected in their content and validity.
impressum.vsbgText1: According to § 36 VSBG (Consumer Dispute Resolution Act - Act on Alternative Dispute Resolution in Consumer Matters), the operator of this website declares:
impressum.vsbgText2: We are neither willing nor obligated to participate in dispute resolution procedures before a consumer arbitration board.

privacyPolicy.responsibleParty: Responsible party within the meaning of data protection laws, in particular the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR), is:
privacyPolicy.contactDataProtectionOfficer: You can exercise the following rights at any time using the contact details of our data protection officer:
privacyPolicy.rightToInformation: Information about your data stored with us and its processing (Art. 15 GDPR),
privacyPolicy.rightToCorrection: Correction of incorrect personal data (Art. 16 GDPR),
privacyPolicy.rightToDeletion: Deletion of your data stored with us (Art. 17 GDPR),
privacyPolicy.rightToRestriction: Restriction of data processing, provided we may not yet delete your data due to legal obligations (Art. 18 GDPR),
privacyPolicy.rightToObjection: Objection to the processing of your data with us (Art. 21 GDPR) and
privacyPolicy.rightToDataPortability: Data portability, provided you have consented to data processing or have concluded a contract with us (Art. 20 GDPR).
privacyPolicy.consentRevocation: If you have given us consent, you can revoke it at any time with effect for the future.
privacyPolicy.complaintRight: You can lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority at any time, e.g. with the competent supervisory authority of the federal state of your residence or with the authority responsible for us as the responsible body.
privacyPolicy.supervisoryAuthorityList: A list of supervisory authorities (for the non-public sector) with addresses can be found at:
privacyPolicy.generalInfoCollection: Collection of general information when visiting our website
privacyPolicy.automaticInfoCollection: When you access our website, i.e. when you do not register or otherwise transmit information, information of a general nature is automatically collected. This information (server log files) includes the type of web browser, the operating system used, the domain name of your Internet service provider, your IP address and similar.
privacyPolicy.processingPurposes: They are processed in particular for the following purposes:
privacyPolicy.connectionEstablishment: Ensuring trouble-free connection establishment of the website,
privacyPolicy.smoothUsage: Ensuring smooth use of our website,
privacyPolicy.systemSecurity: Evaluation of system security and stability as well as
privacyPolicy.websiteOptimization: for the optimization of our website.
privacyPolicy.noPersonalConclusions: We do not use your data to draw conclusions about your person. Information of this kind is evaluated by us anonymously for statistical purposes in order to optimize our website and the underlying technology.
privacyPolicy.legalBasisText: The processing is carried out in accordance with Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR on the basis of our legitimate interest in improving the stability and functionality of our website.
privacyPolicy.technicalServiceProviders: Recipients of the data are technical service providers who act as processors for the operation and maintenance of our website.
privacyPolicy.sessionBasedDeletion: The data is deleted as soon as it is no longer required for the purpose of collection. For data that serves to provide the website, this is generally the case when the respective session is ended.
privacyPolicy.logFileStorage: In the case of storing data in log files, this is the case after 90 days at the latest. Extended storage is possible. In this case, the IP addresses of users are anonymized so that assignment of the calling client is no longer possible.
privacyPolicy.ipAddressNecessity: The provision of the aforementioned personal data is neither legally nor contractually required. However, without the IP address, the service and functionality of our website is not guaranteed. In addition, individual services and services may not be available or restricted. For this reason, an objection is excluded.
privacyPolicy.cookiesDescription: Like many other websites, we also use so-called "cookies". Cookies are small text files that are stored on your device (laptop, tablet, smartphone, etc.) when you visit our website.
privacyPolicy.cookieManagement: You can delete individual cookies or the entire cookie inventory. You will also receive information and instructions on how these cookies can be deleted or their storage can be blocked in advance. Depending on your browser provider, you will find the necessary information under the following links:
privacyPolicy.cookieUsageDescription: Insofar as you allow us to use cookies through your browser settings or consent, the following cookies may be used on our websites:
privacyPolicy.cookieDetails: User consent: Cookie consent preferences and a cookie key. The term is one year.
privacyPolicy.localStorageDetails: Language settings, dark mode and other technical settings are stored in local storage, storage duration is unlimited.
privacyPolicy.sessionStorageDetails: Technical data is stored in session storage, storage duration is active user session time.
privacyPolicy.technicalCookiesDescription: We use cookies to make our website more user-friendly. Some elements of our website require that the calling browser can be identified even after a page change.
privacyPolicy.technicalCookiesPurpose: The purpose of using technically necessary cookies is to simplify the use of websites for users. Some functions of our website cannot be offered without the use of cookies. For these, it is necessary that the browser is recognized even after a page change.
privacyPolicy.technicalCookiesLegalBasis: The processing is carried out in accordance with Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR on the basis of our legitimate interest in a user-friendly design of our website.
privacyPolicy.technicalCookiesRecipients: Recipients of the data are technical service providers who act as processors for the operation and maintenance of our website.
privacyPolicy.technicalCookiesProvision: The provision of the aforementioned personal data is neither legally nor contractually required. However, without this data, the service and functionality of our website is not guaranteed. In addition, individual services and services may not be available or restricted.
privacyPolicy.objectionText: Read the information about your right of objection according to Art. 21 GDPR below.
privacyPolicy.registrationDescription: For registration on our website, we need some personal data that is transmitted to us via an input form.
privacyPolicy.registrationDataCollected: At the time of registration, the following data is also collected:
privacyPolicy.registrationPurpose: Your registration is required for the provision of certain content and services on our website.
privacyPolicy.registrationLegalBasis: The processing of data entered during registration is based on user consent (Art. 6 para. 1 lit. a GDPR).
privacyPolicy.registrationRecipients: Recipients of the data are technical service providers who act as processors for the operation and maintenance of our website.
privacyPolicy.registrationStorageDuration: Data is only processed in this context as long as the corresponding consent exists.
privacyPolicy.registrationProvision: The provision of your personal data is voluntary, based solely on your consent. Without providing your personal data, we cannot grant you access to our offered content.
privacyPolicy.commentFunctionDescription: When users leave comments on our website, in addition to this information, the time of their creation and the username previously selected by the website visitor are also stored. This serves our security, as we can be held liable for unlawful content on our website, even if it was created by users.
privacyPolicy.commentFunctionLegalBasis: The processing of data entered as comments is based on a legitimate interest (Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR).
privacyPolicy.commentFunctionPurpose: By providing the comment function, we want to enable you to interact in an uncomplicated way. Your information is stored for the purpose of processing the request and for possible follow-up questions.
privacyPolicy.commentFunctionRecipients: Recipients of the data are processors.
privacyPolicy.commentFunctionStorageDuration: The data is deleted as soon as it is no longer required for the purpose of collection. This is generally the case when communication with the user is completed and the company can infer from the circumstances that the matter in question has been finally clarified. We reserve the right to delete without giving reasons and without prior or subsequent information.
privacyPolicy.commentDeletion: You can also have your comment deleted by us at any time. Please write an email to the data protection officer listed below or the person responsible for data protection and provide the link to your comment as well as the email address used when creating the comment for identification purposes.
privacyPolicy.commentFunctionProvision: The provision of your personal data is voluntary. Without providing your personal data, we cannot grant you access to our comment function.
privacyPolicy.newsletterDescription: For the delivery of our newsletter, we collect personal data that is transmitted to us via an input form.
privacyPolicy.newsletterDoubleOptIn: For effective registration, we need a valid email address. To verify that registration is actually carried out by the owner of an email address, we use the "double opt-in" procedure. We log the newsletter registration, the sending of a confirmation email and the receipt of the response requested thereby. No further data is collected.
privacyPolicy.newsletterLegalBasis: Based on your express consent (Art. 6 para. 1 lit. a GDPR), we regularly send you our newsletter or comparable information by email to your specified email address.
privacyPolicy.newsletterRevocation: You can revoke your consent to the storage of your personal data and its use for newsletter delivery at any time with effect for the future. Every newsletter contains a corresponding link. You can also unsubscribe directly on this website at any time or inform us of your revocation via the contact option given at the end of these privacy notices.
privacyPolicy.newsletterRecipients: Recipients of the data are processors.
privacyPolicy.newsletterStorageDuration: Data is only processed in this context as long as the corresponding consent exists. After that, it will be deleted.
privacyPolicy.newsletterProvision: The provision of your personal data is voluntary, based solely on your consent. Without existing consent, we unfortunately cannot send you our newsletter.
privacyPolicy.newsletterRevocationRights: You can revoke your consent to the storage of your personal data and its use for newsletter delivery at any time with effect for the future. Unsubscription can be requested via the link contained in each email or from the data protection officer listed below or the person responsible for data protection.
privacyPolicy.googleWebfontsDescription: In order to display our content correctly and graphically appealing across browsers, we use "Google Web Fonts" from Google LLC (1600 Amphitheatre Parkway, Mountain View, CA 94043, USA; hereinafter "Google") to display fonts on this website.
privacyPolicy.googleWebfontsInfo: Further information about Google Web Fonts can be found at
privacyPolicy.sslEncryptionDescription: To protect the security of your data during transmission, we use encryption methods corresponding to the current state of technology (e.g. SSL) via HTTPS.
privacyPolicy.objectionRightTitle: Information about your right of objection according to Art. 21 GDPR
privacyPolicy.objectionRightDescription: You have the right to object at any time, for reasons arising from your particular situation, to the processing of personal data concerning you which is carried out on the basis of Art. 6 para. 1 lit. f GDPR (data processing on the basis of a balancing of interests); this also applies to profiling based on this provision within the meaning of Art. 4 No. 4 GDPR.
privacyPolicy.objectionConsequences: If you object, we will no longer process your personal data unless we can demonstrate compelling legitimate grounds for processing that override your interests, rights and freedoms, or the processing serves to assert, exercise or defend legal claims.
privacyPolicy.policyChangesDescription: We reserve the right to adapt this privacy policy so that it always complies with current legal requirements or to implement changes to our services in the privacy policy, e.g. when introducing new services. Your renewed visit will then be subject to the new privacy policy.
privacyPolicy.questionsToOfficerTitle: Questions to the data protection officer
privacyPolicy.questionsToOfficerDescription: If you have questions about data protection, please write us an email or contact the person responsible for data protection in our organization directly:
privacyPolicy.activeMindAttribution: The privacy policy was created with the help of activeMind AG, experts for
